properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 11 at 6:04PM CST until February 13 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a

* Flood Watch for a portion of south central Missouri, including
the following areas, Howell, Oregon, and Shannon.

* From 6 AM CST Wednesday through Wednesday evening

* Around an inch of rain is expected during the day Wednesday.
Wet soil conditions along with the lack of vegetation in the
winter will cause rainfall to runoff quickly resulting in
potential flooding.

* Flooding of low water crossings and low lying roadways near
streams, creeks, and rivers will be possible, creating
potentially dangerous travel conditions on roads susceptible to
flooding
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING
